original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens stronger at 290.45/65 to dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened marginally stronger at 290.45/55 to the US dollar on Wednesday from 290.50/55 to the US dollar on Tuesday dealers said.
An auction of Rs 192,500 million treasury bills was ongoing.
In equities, the All Share Price Index was up 0.23 percent or 30.08 points, at 13,370. The more liquid S&P SL20 was up 0.22 percent, or 8.64 points, at 3,950.
